publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 70.8 (on the frame); T III 73 (on the fragment)

language.ana: frg:ls-cetom-archaic frg:ls-peyrot-A1 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-malzahn-A2 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-tamai-A1 frg:ls-C14

seg.seg: Of those gifts I have already mentioned [that could serve] the purpose of going towards Maitreya, morality is the one foundation for the world.
Without it the world would not be able to hold the mountains, the trees [and] the human beings together. Without morality, which gifts would one give?
Who does these things, even if he is mean, he will see Maitreya, god of men and gods, [so] (I will teach )

Who does these things, even if he is mean, he will see Maitreya, god of men and gods, [so] (I will teach) them. How will somebody through his foolishness see him in a different manner than with these [things], if gods, kings, and men of property do not [even] see him through [their] nobility? (cf 111)
them. How will somebody through his foolishness see him in a different manner than with these [things], if gods, kings, and men of property do not [even] see him
through their nobility? If only moral behaviour is there, [and] somebody lights even [just] one lamp out of love for me, Śāriputra, he will certainly see

If only moral behaviour is there, [and] somebody lights even [just] one lamp out of love for me, Śāriputra, he will certainly see Maitreya. Even who strews golden flowers over me every day, if (they are not virtuous), by such (people) he (cannot) be seen. (cf 111; 269)
Maitreya. Even who strews golden flowers over me every day, if (they are not virtuous),
by such (people) he (cannot) be seen. This one [Maitreya] could not be reached by force [or] by courage, nor through rites [or] magic, nor through personal determination [or] through royal dignity,
not even through the learning of the arts, nor through heroic strength. Through the good deed [and] through the donation (only)
[Nur] (durch) gute Tat [und] (Gabe) wird man imstande sein, zu Maitreya zu kommen.
[Only] (through) [a] good deed [and] (alms) will one be able to come to Maitreya.
one could go to Maitreya. With good chariots [and] the arms of morality
[well] equipped, with the allies of gift [and] wisdom, the people will come to Maitreya, (to the help and
The people will come to Maitreya, (to the help and stay) of the whole world, he will grant them the amṛta medicine, and they will go out of the saṃsāra prison. (cf 432; 2008a: 270)

protection) of the whole world, he will grant them the amṛta medicine, and they will go out of the saṃsāra prison. Thus the lord Buddha prescribed this at the incident of the question of Śariputra. In (six) ways
(the earth) trembled in the three thousand worlds, ten million Sumeru mountains collapsed and everything (trembled).
In (sechsfacher) Weise erbebte die (Erde) in allen dreitausend Welten.
In (a sixfold) manner the earth shook in all three thousand worlds.

p.note: On IDP, recto and verso are reversed.

list.item: a1 k_uce to[ṃ] wñāwa [āyo]r[n]tā (–)ttr(·)[y](··)_śca [_ś_a]mtsisā papāṣṣorñe tonts pontan_t_s\ [śco] /// a2 nts[e] ke[ntsa] _p_ar[nn]a mā s_t_amoṃ _ṣ_ali stāna onolmī papaṣṣorññesa _p_arna k_uc= āyo /// a3 – k_use toṃn yā_m_aṃ wän_t_a○rwa eynāke rā ksa śamnā ñäktents ñäkteṃ maitreyeṃ [l]k[ā] /// a4 ñä[ś] c[e]n_t_s_a tonmeṃ k[ā] ks= ā[_l_aṃ] lko tākaṃ aknātsaññesā ñäkti lāñco wäntreśśī mā cai /// a5 [k](·)omñesā 30-6 papāṣṣorñe tākaṃn kā ṣeme ra ksa co_k _t_aṅksā twā_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ ñi śa[r]i /// a6 (– – ·)eṃ k_u[s]e ysāṣṣāna pyappyain [r]ā [k]ātaṃ [ñ]ä ··ā – – kau – [kr](·)[i] (–) ·ī /// b1 (–)nts(·) cet= sū lkātsi 30-7 mā yātaṃ sū yänmāts[ī] m[e]yyā[sa] epretñesā ś(·) [t](·) /// b2 [_m_a]ktewñe lantuññesā mā r= āmo_k_ant= āklorsa ma etre_uññai meyyāsā krent yāmo /// b3 taṃ [_ś_a]mtsi maittreye_ṣc\ 30-8 papāṣṣorññeṣṣeṃ kren_t_aṃ yayātā_ṣ_aṃ koklentsā ai /// b4 s[ā] āyorṣṣe ai_ś_amñeṣṣe pantaintsā śāmnā _ś_anmeṃ maittreyeṃ_śc\ po śaiṣṣentse /// b5 saṃtke= w_k_an-m= onwāññe _l_aṃ saṃsārṣṣe pelemeṃ 30-9 ślek te yatka pūdñäkte śāripu[tr]i /// b6 k[n]esa maiwa (– –)[r](·) yäl(·)e po śaiṣṣenne ko[dy]änmā sumerntā naittāre po w[a] ///

a1 Of those gifts I have already mentioned [that could serve] the purpose of going towards Maitreya, morality is the one foundation for the world. a2 Without it the world would not be able to hold the mountains, the trees [and] the human beings together. Without morality, which gifts would one give? a3 Who does these things, even if he is mean, he will see Maitreya, god of men and gods, [so] (I will teach ) a4 them. How will somebody through his foolishness see him in a different manner than with these [things], if gods, kings, and men of property do not [even] see him a5 through their nobility? If only moral behaviour is there, [and] somebody lights even [just] one lamp out of love for me, Śāriputra, he will certainly see a6 Maitreya. Even who strews golden flowers over me every day, if (they are not virtuous), b1 by such (people) he (cannot) be seen. This one [Maitreya] could not be reached by force [or] by courage, nor through rites [or] magic, nor through personal determination [or] through royal dignity, b2 not even through the learning of the arts, nor through heroic strength. Through the good deed [and] through the donation (only) b3 one could go to Maitreya. With good chariots [and] the arms of morality b4 [well] equipped, with the allies of gift [and] wisdom, the people will come to Maitreya, (to the help and b5 protection) of the whole world, he will grant them the amṛta medicine, and they will go out of the saṃsāra prison. Thus the lord Buddha prescribed this at the incident of the question of Śariputra. In (six) ways b6 (the earth) trembled in the three thousand worlds, ten million Sumeru mountains collapsed and everything (trembled).

a1 #M14# k_uce toṃ weñāwa|wñāwa , āyornta|āyorntā ; maitreyeṃśc|(mai)ttr(e)y(eṃ)śca , śamtsisa|śämtsisā #35a papāṣṣorñe , toṃts|tonts pontaṃts|pontants; śc«m»o(ñña |nesäṃ) , śaiṣṣentse|(śaiṣṣe)|ntse a2 #35b kentsa parna|pärnna , mā stämoṃ ; ṣali|ṣäli stāna , onolmi|onolmī #35c papāṣṣorñesa|papaṣṣorññe,sa parna|pärna ; kuce|k_uc= āyo(rnta yā,morntasa) a3 (35) #35d k_use toṃ|toṃn yāmäṃ , wäntarwa|wäntärwa ; ainake|eynāke ra|rā , ksa śāmna|śamnā #36a ñäkteṃts|ñäktents ñäkteṃ , maitreyeṃ ; lakaṃ|lkā(ṃ |su |āksau) , a4 ñäś ceṃts|centsä #36b toṃmeṃ|tonmeṃ kā ksa|ks= ā,läṃ pälkau|«pä»lko ; tākaṃ_(Sg.)|tākaṃ aknātsaññesa|aknā,tsaññesā #36c ñakti|ñäkti lāñc|lāñco , wäntreśśī ; mā cai |(lkān-ne) , a5 klyomñesa|k(ly)omñesā 36 #36d papāṣṣorñe , tākaṃ_(Sg.)|tākaṃn kā ; ṣeme ra ksa , cok taṅksa|täṅksā #37a twāṣṣäṃ ñi śāriputra|śa,ri(putra ; – – – –) , a6 (maitrey)eṃ #37b k_use ysāṣṣana|ysāṣṣāna , pyapyaiṃ|pyappyain ra|rā ; kātaṃ ñä ··ā , – – kau(c) #37c kwri|kr(_u)i (–) ·ī (– – – –) ; śāmnaṃts|(śā)|(mna)nts(o) b1 ceṃts|cet= , su|sū lkātsi 37 #37d mā yātaṃ su|sū , yänmātsi|yänmātsī ; maiyyasa|meyyāsa epretäññesa|ep,retñesā #38a ś(·)t(·)(– – – – –) b2 ; mäktauñe|mäktewñe lantuññesa|lan,tuññesā #38b mā ra|r= amokänta|āmokänt= , āklorsa ; mā|ma etre_uññai , maiyyasa|meyyāsā #38c krent yāmo(rsa) , (āyorsa) ; yātaṃ|(yā)|taṃ b3 śamtsi|śämtsi , maitreyeṃśc|maittreyeṣc 38 #38d papāṣṣorñeṣṣeṃ|papāṣṣorññeṣ,ṣeṃ krentäṃ ; yayātāṣäṃ , kokaleṃtsa|koklentsā #39a ai(– –) b4 sā , āyorṣṣe ; aiśamñeṣṣe|aiśämñeṣṣe , pantaiṃtsa|pantaintsā #39b śāmna|śāmnā śanmeṃ|śänmeṃ , maitreyeṃśc|maittreyeṃśc ; po śaiṣṣentse , (– – – #39c ce) b5 sāṃtke|saṃtk= ewkän-me|ewkän-m= , onuwaññe|onwāññe ; laṃ_(Pl.)|läṃ saṃsārṣṣe , pelemeṃ 39 #39d ślek te yātka|yatka , pūdñäkte ; śāriputri , (prāśänne #40a śkas) yaknesa|(yä)|knesa b6 , maiwa (keṃ ; tarya|ta)r(y) yaltse|yäl(ts)e po , śaiṣṣenne #40b kodyanma|kodyänmā , sumernta|sumerntā ; naittāre po , wa(skāte) #40c ///
On IDP, recto and verso are reversed.
T III MQ 70.8 (on the frame); T III 73 (on the fragment)

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a3-5 Who does these things, even if he is mean, he will see Maitreya, god of men and gods, [so] (I will teach) them. How will somebody through his foolishness see him in a different manner than with these [things], if gods, kings, and men of property do not [even] see him through [their] nobility? (cf [[Couvreur 1954c]]: 111) 672
a5-b1 If only moral behaviour is there, [and] somebody lights even [just] one lamp out of love for me, Śāriputra, he will certainly see Maitreya. Even who strews golden flowers over me every day, if (they are not virtuous), by such (people) he (cannot) be seen. (cf [[Couvreur 1954c]]: 111; [[Pinault 2008]]: 269) 672
b4-5 The people will come to Maitreya, (to the help and stay) of the whole world, he will grant them the amṛta medicine, and they will go out of the saṃsāra prison. (cf [[Schmidt KT 1985]]: 432; 2008a: 270) 662

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
b2-3 [Nur] (durch) gute Tat [und] (Gabe) wird man imstande sein, zu Maitreya zu kommen. 41
b6 In (sechsfacher) Weise erbebte die (Erde) in allen dreitausend Welten. 121
